intro: Homoglossum revolutum var. gawleri, commonly known as the Gawler's homoglossum, is a rare flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, lance-shaped leaves with a revolute margin. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires a warm, Mediterranean climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
